content:
Diagnosis:	Lower third esophageal adenocarcinoma

Management:	15 Apr 2024 Endoscopic ultrasound and biopsy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, HER2 negative, PDL1 CPS 8

Staging:		T3N0M0 (Stage IIB) on PET-CT 20 Apr 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of his staging investigations. He initially presented with progressive dysphagia to solids over 3 months and 5kg weight loss. Endoscopy showed a 4cm circumferential lesion at 35-39cm. PET-CT confirms a locally advanced lower esophageal tumor with no nodal or distant metastatic disease.

He remains able to manage a soft diet with nutritional supplements. His weight has stabilized at 72kg and his performance status is 1. On examination today, there were no concerning features beyond mild epigastric tenderness.

I have discussed his case at our Upper GI MDT. The consensus recommendation is for neoadjuvant chemotherapy with FLOT regimen (4 cycles) followed by surgery. I have explained the treatment plan, including common and serious side effects of chemotherapy. He will require a staging laparoscopy prior to commencing treatment, which I have arranged for next week.

We plan to commence chemotherapy in 2 weeks following insertion of a PICC line. He will be reviewed weekly during treatment by our specialist nurses with formal medical review prior to each cycle.
